Job_Title: Senior/ Regulatory Affairs Associate (Biopharma MNC,JAPAC/ 1-yr contract/Up to $6000) #HKA
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Responsibilities: To act as the representative of the regulatory affairs organization to the JAPAC commercial organization for all aspects related to the assigned projects area. The incumbent will have knowledge of the regulatory requirements of the countries within the region. Under guidance, he/she will combine knowledge of scientific, regulatory and business issues to enable products that are developed, manufactured or distributed to meet required legislation. Represent RA in any cross-functional initiatives being led out of the JAPAC commercial offices or the global RA organization. Supports JAPAC affiliates and Global Regulatory Affairs in Marketing Authorization (MA) related activities for the assigned projects Interfaces with affiliates for the assigned projects, including direct/indirect negotiation with regulatory agencies. Implements regulatory strategies for the assigned projects for countries in JAPAC under supervision, in line with area commercial priorities and in collaboration with the Global Regulatory Lead and other RA sub-team colleagues. Partners with JAPAC commercial teams to ensure business needs are met. Represents the JAPAC regulatory function at sub-teams to present regulatory requirements and commercial interests on the Global Regulatory Product Team (GRPT) to ensure those are met. Represents the JAPAC regulatory function at sub-teams or client group meetings (i.e. commercial, R&D, CMC, etc.) to present regulatory requirements or provide strategic input for the registration of products. Interfaces with Clinical Development as appropriate Assesses scientific data provided by specialist units for registration purposes against JAPAC regulatory/clinical requirements, identifying gaps and developing mitigation strategies to address gaps. Ensures effective presentation of data, complete and timely responses. Compiles and/or prepares regulatory dossier or documents to fulfil local registration requirements in a timely manner. Ensures regulatory compliance for the assigned compounds/products. Implements remediation plan to address identified gaps, if any. Supports area regulatory initiatives for JAPAC affiliates. Requirements: Min BS degree in pharmacy, biomedical engineering, pharmacology, biology or any relevant field Minimum 3 years experience in regulatory with experience in JAPAC Experience with medical device regulation, while not a prerequisite is advantageous Knowledge of the regulatory requirements of the countries within the JAPAC region Able to start on immediate or short notice Comfortable to start off with a 1-year contract (potentially renewable/ convertible basis) Interested candidates please send your updated resume to: [HIDDEN TEXT] Attn: Senior/ Regulatory Affairs Associate (Biopharma MNC,JAPAC/ 1-yr contract/Up to $6000) #HKA We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted EA Personnel: Kayley Ng Yin Yi (R1762843) Company EA Registration Number: Recruit Express Pte Ltd (99C4599) If you meet the requirements of this role, please email a detailed resume in Word document to Kayley Ng Yin Yi. Job_Title: Job Title Account Manager, Client Servicing
Job_Descriptions: Overview You’re becoming a trusted go-to person for the clients on day-to-day requirements, issues and challenges. You are the key project contact with clients, internal teams and other agency partners. You are skillful in delivering high quality of work on time and on budget. With 4-6 years related industry (consulting, digital, agency) experience, you have a solid foundation of how the agency works and able to manage clients’ expectations effectively. You are able to form strong client relationships at the lower-to-mid level. You’re driven by our mission to make our clients’ brands matter, and fundamentally believe that creativity has the power to change fortunes. You are able to work collaboratively with all internal team members to facilitate the process of developing effective strategies and briefs that lead to outstanding creative work. Responsibilities Your focus as an Account Manager: Make our clients’ brands matter by delivering high quality of work and becoming strong advocates for the agency/client relationship. Able to own and execute project management/workflow system, data entry and reporting. Manage client objectives, expectations and timelines, and communicates effectively to the internal team. Able to effectively present work that delivers business success for clients and ensures feasibility of delivery and implementation. Understands scoping of work, mapping of resource requirements and budgets. Achieve mastery of delivering and implementing modern marketing capabilities that build client satisfaction which opens up new growth opportunities for the agency. The skills you learn and apply: Understanding of what makes great work and what it takes to make it happen. Ability to stream briefs into the right workflow based on past experience and a strong understanding of integrated marketing communications principles. Plan, schedule, execute, manage and report on project progress. Ability to manage expectations of internal and external stakeholders and team members. Ability to solve and overcome delivery issues and challenges (i.e. time, resources, budget, capabilities) that meet clients’ and agency’s interests. Relationship-building with internal and external stakeholders to facilitate project outcomes. Qualifications The qualities that will make you successful: - Relentless curiosity - Passion and pride in driving great work - Strong work ethic - Reliable and mature - Good organiser of people, things etc. - Resilience in finding solutions - Ability to build strong connections - Attention to details and robust follow through

Overview You’re becoming an established client lead and have their confidence to guide them to integrated solutions that meets their business needs. You are experienced at orchestrating multiple capabilities and problem-solving to pull the solutions off flawlessly. With 7+yrs related industry (consulting, digital, agency) experience, you have a solid foundation of managing clients and developing senior level client relationships. You’re driven by our mission to make our clients’ brands matter, and fundamentally believe that creativity has the power to change fortunes. You are becoming a trusted advisor to clients, which means you have a track record of delivering consistently to a high standard while striking the right balance between protecting client and agency interests. Clients discuss business issues with you looking for your advice. You’re adept at leading the quartet and leveraging your relationships with internal and external stakeholders to overcome any obstacles for your project. Responsibilities Your focus as an Account Director: Make our clients’ brands matter by bringing together the best mix of Ogilvy capabilities to solve business problems. Facilitate and lead best-in-class modern marketing work that delivers business success for clients and builds agency reputation. Become a trusted advisor to the clients to build client satisfaction and intimacy which opens up new growth opportunities for the agency. Independently lead integrated accounts of up to $1M. Be able to successfully lead medium-sized new business proposals or pitches (up to $1M), and work with Team Leads on larger pitches (>$1M) Responsible for margin growth/protection along with the PMO -including joint ownership of locally agreed targets. Qualifications The skills you learn and apply: Understanding of what makes great work and what it takes to make it happen. Ability to stream briefs into the right workflow based on past experience and a strong understanding of integrated marketing communications principles. A solid understanding of all capabilities (e.g. strategy, social, CXT, PR&I, creative) to be able to facilitate the best work throughout the whole process. A good understanding of modern marketing capabilities (e.g. data analytics, CX, martech etc.) and have experience in integrating it into every applicable project. Relationship-building with internal and external stakeholders to facilitate project outcomes. Ability to think ahead from both technical expertise (of project management and production) and relationships to smooth problem-solving. Having the EQ to facilitate multiple specialists, personalities and opinions. Building the foundation of a trusted client advisor, you are able to listen to client needs without agenda and give them the best advice that strikes the right balance of protecting client and agency interests. Start dealing with senior clients and lay the foundations for senior client relationships. Work with the PMO to ensure smooth, timely delivery, as well as margin growth/protection on projects. Manage at least 1 direct report to impart client service skills and groom them in their growth and promotion. You indirectly manage several supporting team members from different capabilities for each project as you are client lead. Keep up to speed with industry trends and Ogilvy IP (the MBM OS, Big Ideal, Fusion & DAVE) by being curious and well-read. The qualities that will make you successful -         Relentless curiosity -         Strong work ethic -         Articulate and persuasive -         >7 years’ relevant experience -         Reliable and mature -         Ability to build strong connections -         Strong verbal and written communications skills You’re ready to move up when you are able to run a larger portfolio of clients ($1-2M) independently and smoothly by being a trusted client advisor as well as a respected internal business lead.

Overview Business Director You are a leader not by the number of years of experience you have, but the impact you bring to the business. You are a respected leader who knows what is the right mix of skillsets to solve clients’ business problems, and can persuade and orchestrate others towards a successful outcome. You know what makes creativity tick, and are well versed in strategy and technology to deliver work that bring our clients fame and fortune. With 12+yrs related industry (consulting, digital, agency) experience, you can hold court with C-level clients and navigate all levels of client relationships and partnerships to make great work happen. Complexity and challenges do not faze you, your resourcefulness and ability to direct resources and manage internal and external relationships allow you to make things happen. Responsibilities Your focus as a Business Director: Independently lead a portfolio of integrated accounts of $2-4M. Be able to successfully lead large new business proposals or pitches (more than $2M) Manage a portfolio of integrated client work that are recognized for creativity and effectiveness, by drawing on your deep experience in more than 2 client verticals (e.g. FMCG, B2B etc) and client type from large global/regional MNCs to local conglomerates. Create the most powerful work you can to bring our clients fame and fortune, using your arsenal of knowledge in understanding consumers, martech, social, data and creative craft to make it happen. Be a leader that can rally people together, help them grow and bring the best out in them. Developing varied partner relationships in media, research, creative and tech production that will add value to the work we do. Responsible for margin growth/protection along with the PMO -including joint ownership of locally agreed targets. Qualifications The skills you learn and apply: Creating creative and growth opportunities that brings fame and fortune to both clients and the agency. Ability to manage your time, energy, skills and relationships to manage a wider portfolio and more complexity. Transposing your skills from your past experience to build up expertise in new client verticals and increasing your adaptability. Develop gravitas as a client and business leader that internal and external stakeholders turn to for solutions. Developing external partner relationships that add value to our work and make us more connected and influential in the industry. Deepening your knowledge of modern marketing (e.g. data analytics, CX, martech etc.) and getting as much on-ground experience as possible to become a skilled expert. Expanding your awareness of industry technical capabilities (e.g. adtech) in order to build your technical expertise as a client advisor Deepen financial savviness and learn commercial negotiation skills to structure client contracts. Lead and inspire, not just manage a team of at least 5 direct reports to impart client service skills and groom them in their growth and promotion. You indirectly manage several supporting team members from different capabilities as well as external partners for each project as you are client lead. The qualities that will make you successful -         Ability to generate opportunities -         Commercial accumen -         Articulate and persuasive -         >12 years’ relevant experience -         Strong analytical skills -         A talent magnet -         Strong verbal and written communications skills You’re ready to move up when you are not just able to run a larger portfolio of clients (> $5M) and teams but are an influential business operator who is able to create and deliver growth and fame opportunities that truly transforms businesses.

Established in 2020, the Singapore Studio is Riot’s second international game development studio. Working together with our Hong Kong Studio, Riot has been expanding our footprint in Asia and accelerating our talent growth to develop games that deliver great experiences to our players. Our mission is to “scale Riot’s games to hyper-serve players. We partner with our LA headquarters on game development for League of Legends, Teamfight Tactics, and Legends of Runeterra. We’re also building teams for VALORANT and Project L, our take on a fighting game. The Singapore Studio is seeking talented, passionate Rioters with backgrounds in all areas of game development to build games that make it better to be a player. We’re focused on working together to promote individual autonomy, ownership, collaboration, and inclusivity, so every Rioter can be their best while we boldly pursue games. That's where you come in. VALORANT is Riot's take on a character-based tactical shooter (for more info on VALORANT click here!). As a discipline lead for the VALORANT VFX team, you'll lead a team to design and help implement the stylish and dynamic special effects that add atmosphere and depth to gameplay, without sacrificing gameplay readability. You will build and support a high performing external team, and give them the guidance and context they need in order to deliver amazing VFX that set industry standards on craft, whilst enriching the storytelling of the product they support. Through a mix of craft training and hands on leadership, you will level up the team’s craft, mediate and resolve craft disagreements and misalignments, and keep the team motivated towards creating excellent experiences for our players. Using your broad knowledge of the art, craft and technique of VFX, you’ll set clear goals for your team, and make sure the process of delivering those goals is as smooth as possible for both your team and their stakeholders. You will partner closely with the product teams and other artists, ensuring the VFX are not only excellent in a vacuum, but also aligns with the larger product. You will maintain your own craft skills, inspire creativity and keep a high quality bar with hands on VFX work as you deem necessary. Responsibilities: As a craft lead on the team, you will oversee the quality of the work the team deliver, and set the bar for excellence You will build a world class team by sourcing AAA talent in China, and develop and grow their skills through training and feedback You will collaborate with Rioters in Hong Kong, Singapore and worldwide, to make sure product goals are fulfilled and working practices are appropriate You will set a clear vision, provide consistent feedback, build trust with your team Drive the development of Style Guides and Process Guides Lead and improve team rituals to support high quality craft and individual growth You will accomplish your mission with complete autonomy if the need arises; you're dedicated in finding creative and effective solutions to vigilantly eliminate difficult problems Required Qualifications: Demonstrated ability to create high quality in game VFX Extreme proficiency in art fundamentals, visual storytelling and color theory Expertise in the VALORANT VFX style At least 5 years of proven experience leading/mentoring teams and individuals. Growth minded and motivated towards teaching, enabling, and coaching other artists Experience giving thorough direction and delivering timely, clear feedback A strong communicator and able to convey abstract/sophisticated ideas in a concise way, in English or in Chinese Desired Qualifications: Art Leadership experience Experience with creating VFX in Unreal (Niagara, Cascade) Experience teaching Art, and VFX in particular, on-line or in person Familiarly with VALORANT - the game, it’s products, it’s players and community Familiarity with VALORANT Characters, IP Universes and Lore Mandarin speaker Our Perks: Full relocation support Full health insurance for you, your spouse and children Open paid time off Retirement benefits with company matching Life insurance, parental leave, plus short-term and long-term disability Play Fund so you can broaden and deepen your knowledge of our players and community through games We will double down on your donations of time and money to non-profits Don’t forget to include a resume and cover letter. We receive a lot of applications, but we’ll notice a fun, well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously. As a part of the application process, candidates are expected to provide a portfolio of their work and may be asked to complete an art test.

Nomura Overview Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com Function Overview We offer global cash equity execution with a dominant presence on multiple stock exchanges coupled with highly regarded market insights, corporate access and Equity Financing services. We also provide competitive pricing in single stock and index options, ETFs and Swaps, offering clients a full suite of synthetic financing solutions including OTC and listed products. Job Responsibilities: AEJ Equity Hedge Fund Sales is responsible for servicing institutional hedge fund equity clients and distribute Nomura's research content and cash & non-cash services. The role will require: Partner closely with internal stakeholders (Research, Prime Brokerage, Trading, Syndicate etc.) to drive monetization of Nomura's equity content business and Syndicate deals Line up cross-sell opportunities for our non-cash (i.e. PB, Delta1, etc) & execution services offerings Proactive in developing key hedge fund relationships and self-starter in pursuit of new clients Support Regional sales team on client requests Working with our corporate access teams to think of various events we could host Idea generation and managing existing ideas for alpha capture and other quantitative clients; furthering our relationship with quant funds Job Requirements: Minimum a Bachelor's degree with quantitative specialisation (e.g. Economics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics etc.) from a well-regarded university Minimum 3 years of experience working in a Hedge Fund Sales or Research Sales within the Equity space in a Bank or a Financial Institution Analytical and quantitative skills with prior knowledge of Financial Market products and a solid traction of Hedge fund clientele from key markets globally Self-starter, outgoing, energetic, proactive, and possess a positive attitude Able to work independently and coordinate with key stakeholders within the firm Able to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment, and under pressure. Diversity Statement Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. Job_Title: Head of Digital & Client Experience Governance, Global Consumer Banking, Asia-EMEA
Job_Descriptions: The Head of Digital & Client Experience Governance supports the Regional Digital & Client Experience (DCX) Head in developing, executing and communicating the digital governance strategy across the region. This is a critical leadership role responsible for driving a robust regional control and risk framework with country teams and line of business stakeholders. This role defines, manages, supports and facilitates an effective end-to-end governance process for digital delivery across the APAC-EMEA region and countries. This Head of Digital & Client Experience Governance develops and maintain linkages with other essential regional partners to ensure ongoing stakeholder communication and involvement in managing key risks. This role will work closely with global, regional and country stakeholders, such as Consumer Business Operational Risk & Control (CBORC), Independent Risk, Compliance, Product teams and Technology to assess and mitigate key risks impacting digital channels and client experience. This role is also responsible for driving digital control activities to address emerging risks, process gaps and improvements, and delivering tactical and strategic execution plans to ensure all digital control programs and activities support the Global Consumer Bank’s (GCB) mission to create the best experience for customers and being a world-class Digital Bank. Responsibilities : Works closely with global and regional teams – CBORC, Product, Operations, and second and third lines of defense –to define, coordinate and drive a cohesive strategy for digital controls and monitoring. Looks for opportunities to transform, automate and simplify the control and monitoring roadmap and processes in our digital space. Prioritizes focus areas and ensures global alignment. Ensures full understanding of all activities across the region – Digital, Product, Control Functions – related to digital control and monitoring, and prioritizes those areas where further investment is required to minimize risk and generate business value. Leads internal negotiations and discussions to develop & drive medium- to long-term plans to deliver on our annual governance goals. Independently assesses risks and drives actions to address the root causes that persistently lead to ineffective controls monitoring and process gaps by challenging both historical and proposed practices; identifies emerging digital risks and process gaps or issue patterns in the context of the current economic, regulatory and business environment and assures that measures are being taken to mitigate these risks across the region, including proper issue escalations to avoid surprises. Drives decisions related to utilization of digital control, testing and automated tools that are consistent with the strategy. Establishes and oversees the application of operational risk policies, technology and tools, and governance processes to create sound solutions that ensure compliance with internal processes, controls, Global Policies and Procedures and emerging risks. Leads successful & timely completion of regulatory and audit commitments working in partnership with all relevant stakeholders. Works closely with all lines of defense to establish an open and trusted relationship that result in an effective controls & monitoring digital strategy and framework. Assists in responding to requests for information and documents from the company’s external regulators and other stakeholders. Owns & reinforces compliance with the Asia Digital Delivery Procedures (ADDP) and Citi’s Risk Governance Framework, and contributes to the directional controls strategy of establishing a sound delivery routine in alignment with GCT SDLC, program management and product approval requirements. Monitors, and presents analysis and analytics to demonstrate controls are effective or where we have opportunities for improvement. Investigates causes for metrics that are deviating from trends and escalate situations that pose excessive risk(s). Manages a team of individuals, and coaches and grooms team members in handling the day-to-day activities and decision making relating to Product governance. Development Value : The position provides a unique vantage point to gain knowledge of the digital strategy and development process, and effectuate change across the DCX organization. This position serves as a thought leader at regional and global governance forums, and drives transformational change across digital. Significant amount of interaction with Product teams, Control Functions subject matter experts and senior management - at the global, regional, country levels. Required Skills : Ability to responsibly challenge the status quo and craft a vision for transformational change. Ability to decipher complex terms and concepts, and manage large projects. Process, risk & controls, governance and solution oriented, with ability to identify and execute on change. Strategic and goal-oriented thinker; generates a vision, establishes direction, creates an atmosphere of trust, and encourages ongoing improvement. Exceptional ability to execute with urgency and positive energy. Track record of driving timely results across multiple products, functions and regions. Understanding of cross-functional banking functions; ability to work with multi-functional partners and internal stakeholders, across lines of business, Technology, Risk, AML and Fraud. Ability to influence without direct authority and shape direction at senior levels. Excellent facilitation and partnering skills with key stakeholders and Senior Management. Ability to communicate in a compelling manner with all levels of management and across all functional areas – both written and oral. Knowledge of various risks faced by the business and ability to identify risk management solutions within the organization. Demonstrated leadership of large and diverse groups of people across geographies, while providing thought leadership and driving strategic change. High intellectual curiosity. Action-oriented, entrepreneurial, flexible, and innovative approach to operational management. Ability to review large quantities of data and extract key points and actions necessary. Understanding of ‘design thinking’ and experience of true agile working to develop business solutions. Passion, humility, integrity, positive attitude, mission-driven, approachable and self-directed. Strong interpersonal skills – including teamwork and organizational skills. Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task. Ability to work under pressure, tight deadlines and with unexpected requirement changes. Education/Experience : Bachelor’s/University degree. 15+ years’ experience in risk & controls and governance, preferably in banking. Effective verbal, written and negotiation skills Effective project management skills Effective influencing and relationship management skills ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Compliance and Control ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Governance ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job_Title: Director - Global Pricing and Commercial Management
Job_Descriptions: Director - Global Pricing and Commercial Management Location: Other locations:  Anywhere in Region Date:  17-Feb-2022 At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. One of our key objectives is to Price with Confidence to ensure we are receiving full value from our clients for our services and solutions.  You will play an important role working with senior executives responsible for some of our most important accounts (“G360s”) to improve our pricing and profitability. The opportunity The Director, Pricing & Commercial Management supports and enables G360 and other large accounts to generate profitable growth through the development and negotiation of Commercial Frameworks, including global rate cards, MSA commercial terms and discount structures. You will be part of our Global Pricing & Commercial Management team (“GPCM”) and work globally with our most important accounts. GPCM is an experienced senior team of professionals who develop trusted relationships with our most important clients and senior executives of our account teams. GPCM operates in a fast-paced environment and is part of our global Strategic Deals team. Your key responsibilities Your key responsibilities include: Providing pricing and commercial support to our G360 and other large account Global Client Service Partners (“GCSPs”) and their account teams in negotiations with their clients’ procurement teams Developing multi-country Commercial Frameworks (global rate cards, commercial terms and conditions and discount structures)  Key indicators of success in this area include: accurate benchmarking of prices against the competition and the market more generally; and alignment of the commercial approach with the objectives specified by the GCSP for the Account; Developing, and if required leading, the negotiation strategy of the Commercial Framework Where requested by the GCSP, providing pricing support to client proposals and bids linked to the Commercial Frameworks Providing advice on the structure and governance of cross-border commercial arrangements (including working with EY’s tax experts to identify and mitigate unrecoverable tax costs) Working with global service line leaders to develop innovative, competitive and profitable global pricing frameworks and methodologies for new and existing service offerings You will be based in APAC and willing to travel to work in different locations to work with both clients and account teams Skills and attributes for success To qualify for the role you must have A self-starting and pro-active attitude as well as the drive, enthusiasm, imagination and resourcefulness to get the job done with the available resources within the required timetable The ability to build effective relationships with clients at an appropriate level. You should have a history of maintaining senior relationships with clients and be able to use these skills to develop relationships for EY with senior representatives within the procurement functions of EY’s G360 Accounts in order to complement other relationships already maintained by the wider Account team. Resilience to clearly state and justify your commercial position and persuasion skills to get others to accept your point view Excellent analytical skills in order to understand and explain complex commercial situations A commitment to achieve challenging commercial objectives whilst maintaining high standards of fairness and integrity at all times. Ideally, you’ll also have An external perspective of “best practice” in commercial arrangements with clients. Experience as “Director” or “Head of” in another ‘Big 4’ accounting firm or another international blue-chip professional service firm. At least 15 years professional experience in proposing, negotiating and delivering professional services to clients Detailed knowledge of the service offerings made by the ‘Big 4’ accounting firms (having in many cases delivered such service to clients) together with a thorough understanding how each of the offerings can be priced effectively to maximize both value and margin A point of competitive differentiation by being regarded as the natural first port of call when client procurement specialists are looking to test new commercial ideas and whose views would be highly valued in shaping their ideas before reaching out to a wider supplier community in a more formal way. What we look for The ideal candidate should have a tertiary qualification (e.g. MBA) in business administration, accountancy, or a related discipline or equivalent. What working at EY offers As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, globally diverse team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2021 a reality. If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team. Build your legacy with us EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Cohesity radically simplifies data management. We make it easy to back up, manage, and derive value from data -- across the data center, edge and cloud. Cohesity also helps ensure data is in compliance and protected against ransomware attacks. We offer a full suite of data management services consolidated on one multicloud data platform, reducing complexity and eliminating mass data fragmentation. Cohesity can be delivered as a service, self-managed, or provided by a Cohesity-powered partner. We’ve been named a Leader by multiple analyst firms, and are prominently featured in the Forbes Cloud 100 and CRN’s Coolest Cloud companies. Our growth is off the charts, and we’re just getting started! The Site Reliability Engineer (or Technical Support Engineer) is a senior technical support role within the Cohesity support organization. The position is based in Singapore, where you will have the opportunity to work with other talented engineers to ensure that Cohesity customers receive the highest level of support possible. We are looking for passionate people who possess deep technical expertise as well as excellent communication and customer service skills to join our team! Primary job responsibilities Work with Cohesity customers to provide a timely resolution to technical issues that they may encounter Use available tools to investigate and troubleshoot technical issues Record customer interactions, including investigation, troubleshooting, and the resolution of issues Work closely with Cohesity engineering and account management teams Demonstrate considerable judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions Provide the best experience possible for Cohesity customers Manage workload to ensure that all customer issues are resolved in a timely manner Assist in the development of comprehensive and reusable self-service solutions for future incidents Develop knowledge base article. Mentor other engineers. Required Skills 5+ years of experience working in a storage, networking, and virtualization environment Strong understanding of Linux and administration experience across all working components Ability to analyze system diagnostics and clearly articulate the issue for the customer Good understanding of Linux debugging utilities, with an emphasis on systemtap, tcpdump ftrace, strace, wireshark, gdb, and crash Experience with remote file access protocols, including NFS, SMB (CIFS) Solid experience with storage-related concepts, including virtualization and data protection (e.g. VMware, CommVault, Symantec, EMC, NetApp) Strong communication skills in both Mandarin and English #LI-FR1 Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates: For information on personal data processing, please see our Privacy Policy. Senior Manager, Customer Advocacy Job Description: This senior customer advocacy role is part of an integrated corporate communications team. We’re looking for team members who can help build and manage Cloudera’s customer advocacy program in APAC. You will be responsible for identifying and delivering on customer storytelling and reference priorities across the organization. You will also be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with regional customers, and working with them to capture and share their success stories. As a member of the corporate communications team, you will need to collaborate with teams and key stakeholders across the company - ranging from product business units and engineering to marketing, sales and PR/AR teams. The ideal candidate will be comfortable building relationships with teams throughout Cloudera that can advance integration and increase speed of program development. Key Responsibilities: Lead a wide range of customer advocacy and engagement initiatives with our existing APAC customer base Build processes to support regular customer outreach, nurture relationships and encourage participation in Cloudera programs Partner with sales, marketing, customer success, and product teams to maintain a complete view of customer relationships, including health, readiness to engage and active requests Manage customer storytelling and reference materials requests, and development to support marketing and sales activities including PR, AR, blogs, social media and events Maintain regular reporting to measure the success and impact of customer advocacy program Qualifications: Demonstrated account management or consulting experience; have experience working in, or with, PR and communications Strategic thinker who is proactive and innovative in approaching customers and capturing stories Effective communicator across multiple stakeholders and seniority levels Ability to take initiative and seize opportunities in a fast-paced environment Desired Skills and Experience 6+ years of account management, consulting, customer relationship management or related experience Experience working with B2B technology companies Strong project management skills Excellent written and verbal communication Resourceful, energetic, solutions -oriented At Cloudera, we believe that data can make what is impossible today, possible tomorrow. We empower people to transform complex data into clear and actionable insights. Cloudera delivers an enterprise data cloud for any data, anywhere, from the Edge to AI. Powered by the relentless innovation of the open source community, Cloudera advances digital transformation for the world’s largest enterprises. Learn more at cloudera.com. Job_Title: Job Posting Title Senior/ QA Executive
Job_Descriptions: Are you energized by a quality assurance role that allows you to accelerate compliance in a state of the art manufacturing environment?  If so, this Senior/ QA Executive role could be an ideal opportunity to explore. As a Senior/ QA Executive , you will be responsible to lead and support the site's regulatory conformance activities, as well as maintain effective and compliant quality systems relating to self-inspections, audit management, quality risk management, management review and quality escalations. This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following: General For each assigned area : Be the process owner to achieve compliance with regulations, QMS and company policies Be the subject matter experts (SMEs) for the site Proficient in the respective SAP and IT modules Provide business support to site employees Review and revise the relevant SOPs Manage the relevant training programs, such as maintaining the training schedule, training materials and trainers Perform gap assessments between local procedures and above- site documents, such as Vaccines SOPs (VSOPs) and QMS Perform periodic reviews as required As a site representative, create effective interfaces with internal and external stakeholders such as global and fellow process owners to share best practices and drive continuous improvements Regulatory Compliance Serve as Single Point of Contact (SPOC) between the site and Global Regulatory Affairs (GRA) on regulatory compliance matters. Support file submission efforts in close coordination with GRA and internal stakeholders. Support GRA and the site in providing responses to questions from Health Authorities (HA), supported by the relevant data package where necessary. Assess the potential regulatory impact of changes proposed by the site, and work with GRA to formulate and execute the submission strategy where necessary. Assess the potential regulatory impact of deviations Audits and Self-Inspections Prepare and Lead inspection readiness programmes for L2+ and above audits Prepare the site external audits, lead the backroom staff during the audit, and coordinate sitewide inspection readiness activities In partnership with key stakeholders, define site CAPAs timely in response to findings and track to closure. Ensure timely closure of CAPAs, and extensions are escalated as appropriate. Own the site self-inspection process, and work with internal stakeholders to develop, publish and manage the annual self- inspection plan. Quality Risk Management Own the quality risk management process and manage the process from risk identification to assessment, timely mitigation and closure. Ensure risks are escalated timely and as appropriate Maintain and update quality risk register Management Review — Site Quality Council Work with SLT to align KPIs to monitor for the year. Prepare for and manage the SQC meetings, ensuring decisions and action logs are captured through the meeting minutes, and followed through during the SQC meetings. Quality Escalations Own and manage the Site Quality Escalation Process Quality & Regulatory Intelligence (QRI) Serve as Single Point of Contact (SPOC) between the site and Global QRI team. Manage the QRI process to ensure that local impact assessment, if required, is completed timely. EHS Comply with company requirements on EHS Data Integrity Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Diploma with relevant in-depth experience or Degree holder in Science or Engineering discipline Preferably 3 years' experience in the pharmaceutical industry in GMP regulated areas and 5 years or more for the role of the Senior QA Executive Must have a good understanding of cGMP, regulatory and legal requirements as applied to quality assurance of vaccine manufacturing and product registration (e.g. QA compliance, regulatory affairs / support or site conformance) Must have background in audit management either as internal auditor or involved in the preparation of major health authority inspection (e.g. FDA or EU) Has Knowledge and experience in data integrity principles and control is an advantage preferred A good team player and able to work independently Communication and interpersonal skills Analytical and problem solving skills Why GSK? At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing . So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *This is a job description to aide in the job posting, but does not include all job evaluation details. Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Company Description H&M is on a journey to becoming the leading destination for style, creativity and culture. We want to enable, empower and engage teams while building on our passion for being the truly customer-centric company we are. On this journey we want to encourage our teams to learn and grow meaningfully, unleashing their full potential – fulfilling our Employee Value Proposition (EVP), we are a place of possibilities and where you can Be Yourself & More. Job Description You are responsible for supporting the brand and hiring managers in strengthening People and Culture, by setting and implementing talent acquisition strategies and initiatives to deliver high performing teams, drive continuous talent growth as well as acquiring right skills and competency – future proofing the business from a talent perspective. You contribute actively to employer branding, both internal and external, bringing to live our Employee Value Proposition and building a true sense of belonging among teams. Key responsibilities:Attract, Recruit and Introduce Initiate, propose and take actions to make H&M an attractive employer, both internally and externally. Analyze future teams’ needs, in terms of skills and competency, establish an action plan  to close gaps through meaningful collaboration with Country HRM as well as respective hiring managers and stakeholders. Implement and uphold a quality recruitment process for all positions, inline with global and local routines as well as labor legislation. Supports the development of people centricity in hiring managers by introducing the talent mindset - influencing managers through recruitment process and frequent conversation about talents. Network and maintain strong connections to talents, talents pools and talent agencies, through frequent chats and is up to date with insights on industry trends. Collaborate, Manage and Develop You are the speaking partner to hiring managers and supports with acquiring right talent for the team as well as mapping future skills and competency needs. The recruitment journey is fully managed and coordinated by you from start to finish ensuring a good candidate experience, positive employer branding as well as ensuring deadlines are met and feedbacks given as appropriate. You support the development of hiring managers in taking a wholistic view of their teams through influencing and catalytic actions – such as regular check ins on performance and development potentials, upskilling needs, disengagement and flight risk, general well being and psychological safety. Provide HR support and consultation to managers through coaching, training and advice that are aligned to H&M Brand’s culture and value as well as EVP. Qualifications Being part of this journey means there is not one clear path. We ask of you to be open to change and take part in creating an organization for the future. This is an opportunity for open minded team players that by being curious, innovative and forward-thinking want to change our business and the whole industry. We ask you to be yourself, drive results, work towards goals and go for it with everything you’ve got. Besides your personality we see that you have / are: Formal education and adequate work experience in HR / Talent / People growth related field. Experience in talent acquisition within retail setting in Sales, Support, and Store roles, as well as acquisition during change and transformation. Capable in identifying talent opportunities with hiring managers as well as developing on future needs and talent pipeline of  teams. Ability to interact confidently, clearly and respectfully with stakeholders, influence and handle pushback in high pressure situation. Proficient in Microsoft suites of application and is confident building business cases and presentation to large audience and stakeholders. Excellent internal drive, results driven and willingness to learn and feed the organization with new insights. Effective and inspiring communicator, charismatic, clear and convincing – positively energetic and is not afraid to build relations on both a personal and group level. Influential and catalyst leader with experience in leading teams, self, as well as meaningful collaboration with key stakeholder. Experience working in an executional, cross functional role - collaborating with multiple teams across different geographies. Additional Information ARE YOU READY TO JOIN US? If you feel that your passion, personal values, ambition and experience are a match –  please apply (including Cover Letter, Resume, and if applicable: 360 Leadership Feedback report, Strengths Finder, Myers Briggs) no later than 18th FEB 2022. We’re more about personality and competence than qualifications, so don’t worry if your skills aren’t a perfect match. This position is based in Singapore Office and will report to Talent Manager - SGMYVN.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description We are looking to host solution-minded student to embark their internship journey with us. Here’s your chance to create a journey with us. Come join our medical start-up. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is a medical start-up developing an advanced machine vision tracking system for the management of Overactive Bladder (OAB). Our goal is to design and develop a proprietary diagnostic tool to analyze real-time images of the bladder. The diagnostic tool will help pinpoint unusual muscle group activity to help in the treatment of OAB. We need passionate and flexible engineers to grow with us. EndoSiq Technology Pte Ltd is incubated by Trendlines Medical Singapore Pte Ltd. Project Name: Deep-Learning architecture development involving 2D and 1D vascular datasets such as specklegram / photoplethysmogram biosignals for polymorphic determination in cardiometabolic diseases Background: Worldwide, a third of adults suffer from some form of Cardiovascular disease (CVD) which annually contribute to the deaths of 17.7 million people globally, accounting for 31% of total deaths. In comparison, the combined annual deaths resulting from HIV/Aids, malaria, and tuberculosis combined only amount to 3.86 million. Hypertension affects at least 25% of the global adult population and is the most common cause of CVD-related deaths due to associated secondary pathologies. There is also a significant association of hypertension with type 2 diabetes mellitus (DM) with hypertension being twice as frequent in diabetic sufferers compared to non-diabetics. By 2050, Singapore projects that there will be 1 million sufferers of diabetes, accounting for 10% of the disease burden in Singapore. Disease prediction solely from genotyping has resulted in poor associations due to unexpected multi-nomic interactions. Scope: This project proposal seeks to apply advanced Machine Learning (ML) or Deep Learning (DL) algorithms on 1D/2D datasets to identify potential pleiotropic relationships in cardiometabolic diseases. We will also evaluate the predictive performance and accuracy of various AI-ML algorithms. The objective is to develop an advanced Artificial Intelligence (AI) architecture extracting critical features from the pulsatile morphology of 1-Dimensional PPG signals or 2D vascular videos to form an adaptive numerical model of an individual. Due difficulty in acquiring real-world biosignal datasets, novel techniques will need to be implemented to address the limited data available for training such as autonomous semi-supervised neural network designs. The project will involve 1D/2D signal processing and deep learning and will require strong knowledge in Python programming. Application Deadline: 1 May 2022 Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends
